course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Corporate Strategy
course.description: Major techniques and approaches to the development and implementation of corporate strategies. Underlying concepts; analytical techniques; internal and external competitor analysis and evaluation of strategic options.

reviews.author: Flanker
reviews.title: Pavel = God
reviews.comment_content: briefly talks about cooperate strategy mostly common sense but explain through a lot of jargon to make it looks professional and systematic lol . Also teaches about how to case analysis with different tools ------- mostly already learnt in Yr1 or Yr2 but apply it deeply .
reviews.comment_teaching:
Usually consist of two main parts:  teaching and case.
Teaching usually using notes(given), fully packed with text and graphs.

I think case study is quite useful especially Prof is a ex-McKinsey, teach you how to think logically.
reviews.comment_grading:
Extremely generous grading, even you below mean in the midterm and final, if you perform good in the group project, you may still get A range.

Better to take attendance and answer more , as Prof. will make a seating plan after add-drop period.
reviews.comment_workload:
iPRS required

In class contribution required during case study, should study the case deeply

Have midterm and final, quite tricky, remember all the things mentioned in the notes if possible, especially for those terms.

Have group project, group mates randomly assigned by prof, only the final presentation and report counts towards marks.

reviews.author: cklltc
reviews.comment_content: quite easy to understand and interesting
reviews.comment_teaching:
Wang is quite nice and does not have an obvious accent.
She loves students to speak more in class. So. please answer her question and she will also give you very high class participation mark.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A grade though my midterm is not that good (14/20, above mean)
I would say you have to find good groupmate. coz Group project may help adjust your poor performance in midterm

I also paid high effort in my individual paper
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is relatively acceptable as shown below

1. Class attendance:  10%
2. Class participation: 10%
3. Middle term (multiple choice questions and
open-ended questions) : 20%
4. Group presentation (analyse business cases: the real world examples of business challenges and
managerial problems): 30%
5. Individual paper (choose your own interested company and pertinent analytical frameworks
to analyse the company): 30%
Total: 100%

reviews.author: Krisha
reviews.comment_content:
Enjoyable and applicable to real life.
He generally starts off by asking about current affairs and how they are relevant to our study.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very straightforward and interactive :) He responds to emails very effectively and is always willing to help beyond class hours. Also helps with job hunting.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is easy to score on if you follow instructions in class and meet all the deadlines.
reviews.comment_workload:
Managable: 3 cases, Group presentation, Final exam
- The final exam was open book and open ended so you can answer questions based on your opinion as long as it is justfied.

reviews.author: happy egg
reviews.title: Review summary
reviews.comment_content: Attractive. learn a lot of theories and the way to access the competitiveness of companies.
reviews.comment_teaching: His lesson are a bit boring but gives good grade. He gives a lot of examples during lessons and elaborate deeply.
reviews.comment_grading:
Excellent grading. He gave similar comment to everyone in class. Remember to speak more during class as class parti and attendance accounts for 20% of the final grade. Got A in the end.

individual work (50%)
class attendance and parti 20%
individual case report 20%
peer evaluation 10%

group work (50%)
group case presentation 15%
final group mini project presentation 20%
final group mini project report 15%
reviews.comment_workload: Only have a few things to work on throughout the semester. One individual case report and two group projects. Remember to score high in the individual one cause I guess the group project mark is very similar for everyone.

reviews.author: 科大學生
reviews.title: Easy and good grades
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is not difficult. Just some normal business analysis framework and other case studies. The content is relatively easy for a 4000level course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is ok, not too boring though some of the time she just reads along with the ppt. She encourages the student to answer her questions so there is a lot of discussion time.
reviews.comment_grading: She only gives out the result of the mid term report so I do not know my total score. I got slightly above mean in the midterm report and I think I did ok in the presentation and individual paper. I also actively participated in class so I guess that gives me some participation score. I got an A so I would say the grading is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is ok. There is no exam for this course. One 20 min group presentation and one individual paper for about 10 pages and also one midterm report. Also, some case studies about 6 in total. You just need to read it before the lesson and discuss it in class.

reviews.author: bigyeet
reviews.title: Everything but an Exam ;)
reviews.comment_content: The content was interesting. Very relevant and not too academically challenging. A lot of it was content I had previously learnt, just in a little more depth. We had weekly case studies, but not too much pressure with these, just had to participate in class, there was no assessment on the case studies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Dangqing explains concepts well. Pay attention to her class discussions as our mid-term report questions were based on what was discussed in class, I was lucky I wrote a few notes which helped carry me through.
reviews.comment_grading: Not sure what you have to do to get an A+ but then again that's every UST course. It was not too difficult to get an A ranged grade (but that's just my opinion and I personally enjoyed the course and it's content a lot). I think if you try hard enough A range or at least a B+ is very doable.
reviews.comment_workload:
I highly recommend taking her session. I was a little unsure about taking her section at first as there were no UST Space reviews, but her workload was very very reasonable. Here's a breakdown of our assessments.

Class Participation 10% (Just speak in class, especially during case study discussions)

Class Attendance 10% (ikr 10% for just showing up to class is a pretty solid bargain)

Mid-term report 20% (this was just based on 3 questions she submitted and she gave us a week to answer them.

Group Presentation 30% (Make sure you choose a good team and here's a tip send in your names closer to the deadline because she did our presentation order based on who submitted their finalized team names first lol, so we submitted second and presented second, unintentionally ofc)

Individual Paper 30% (for this you have to write about whatever business topic you want and make it relevant to course content. The criteria for us was almost the same as the presentation criteria, so it's pretty much the same workload but you gotta do it all by yourself. I did mine on sneakers lol but still ended up doing pretty well).

reviews.author: asdfghjkl
reviews.title: Normal good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Blow water thing
concepts include:
Internal/External analysis, integration strategies (M&A...), international strategies etc
reviews.comment_teaching: Blow water style, make things complicated but is a nice Korean
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance 5%
participation 15%
final project 40%
final exam 40%

Final project ard 21/40, final exam 30/40. Attached is the distribution of the final project and exam.
End up having a B+, better than expected cuz my group probably fucked up the project.
Just joined the meetings and played computer, never asked/answered any questions in class.
reviews.comment_workload:
project (proposal, presentation, and report) <-random grouping, content: choose a company, adopt Internal and External analysis, and suggest strategic decision

parti (6 weekly assignment [read a long case and answer 1-2 short questions, 9write is ok], in-class discussion[ in-class exercise (group), ask/answer questions)

final is a comprehension exercise: read a case and answer questions. Have 4 questions in total (ard 10 marks each), your answer should be within 300 words. Just blow water thing, but need to be aware of time management.

reviews.author: Krispy
reviews.comment_content: Content for this course is alright. Mostly just introducing frameworks for internal and external analysis for companies. It can get a bit dry at times especially since there are a lot of frameworks, but once you get the gist of it you'll be fine. The course focuses on the application of frameworks and you'll have to apply these frameworks for your group project and in-class case studies.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is highly enthusiastic and loves to elaborate on real life examples for each framework. He might get boring at times, but it really depends on your own interest in the subject. He'll also encourage you to speak up in class and gives out participation cards for speaking up.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite good. As long as you attend all his classes, you'll get attendance points (5%). Though you'll have to speak up in class in order to get participation points, which counts for 10% of your grade.

Midterm is quite easy. 40 MCQs and 8 short answer questions.

Final exam has 40 MCQs and a mini case study and approx 8 open ended questions that are worth approx 4-10 marks each. Come prepared for the final exam as the case study is quite tough.

You can easily score for the group project depending on the company that you choose. Your group mates are randomly assigned. You'll have to submit a final report and give a presentation to the class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Personally, I think that the workload for this course is very light as I enjoyed reading the case studies. You don't really have to prep much. Just make sure that you understand and remember the frameworks taught in the previous lectures. His exams are non-cumulative so you don't have to worry so much about cramming. Just focus on understanding the concepts and it'll be fine.

I was lucky to have good group mates and we decided on things pretty fast, so we managed to get things done efficiently. You should also choose a company that you are genuinely interested in so that your group project will be fun and you won't feel like its a burden.

reviews.author: KaruizawaKei
reviews.comment_content:
Feb 9
Course Introduction
Overview of Strategic Mana
Feb 16
External Analysis
Case 1: Cola Wars
Feb 23
Internal Analysis
Mar 2
Case 2: Wal*mart Stores Inc.
Competitive Advantage and Firm Performance
Mar 9
Business Strategy
Mar 16
Case 3: Samsung
Midterm exam review
Mar 23 Midterm Exam
Mar 30
Corporate Strategy (1)
Apr 6 Midterm Break
Apr 13
Corporate Strategy (2)
Case 4: Newell
Apr 20
International Strategy
Corporate Governance
Apr 27
Case 5: Sunbeam
Organization (Structure, Culture & Controls)
Final exam review
May 4 Presentation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent Teaching! Professor YOUNG always explains the concept clearly. She includes many examples for illustration.

She gave us many chances to get the participation points.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance and participation 15%
Attendance, and contribution during class
Midterm 20%
Include stuff before midterm, which is the business strategy
Final 20%
Non-cumulative, only includes those corporate strategy level knowledge

Current Event Presentation 10%
Paired work, you can find your preferred partner.
Final Project Paper 20%
Final Project Presentation 15%
reviews.comment_workload:
It is quite high because of few reasons:
1. everybody is active during class. What you can do is to keep blowing water
2. 2 group projects, which means high workload. It will become much heavier if you faced some free riders.
3. highly-competitive. The mean for all components are very high!

reviews.author: Hayoha
reviews.title: Very good professor but the workload is a bit too heavy for a 3 credits course
reviews.comment_content:
External analysis
Internal analysis
SWOT analysis
Corporate Strategy
Business structure and culture

5 cases:
1. Cola War
2. Walmart
3. Samsung
4. Newell
5. Sunbeam
reviews.comment_teaching:
She is very good person and well prepared for the classes. She was teaching in a good manner even this was the first semester she taught.

Even she was hurted in a car crash during the final period, she still tried her best to grade all of us and release the score as soon as possible. She is really responsive and the discussions during lectures are good for learning. One time, she conduct the prisoner's game for us to play and the group with highest score can have free Pacific Coffee drink.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Attendance/ Class participation 15%
2. Midterm Exam 20%
3. Final Exam 20% (non-culmulative)
4. Current Event Paired Presentation 10%
5. Final Project Paper 20% (report)
6. Final Project Presentation 15%

There are actually 2 group projects, one for 2 people group (10% that one) and 1 for 6-7 people group (report and final presentation). Good thing is you can choose your group members. Paired Presentation is video format, and you can cut and edit if you needed.

There are some problems with the record of class participation as she just sometimes let students to tick for themselves but eventually everyone is confused as there are 3 columes, or even 4, I forgot, the attendance, individaul participation, group participation. Then when 1 student answered question, it counts as his/her all 3 columes or just what? Anyway, as long as one person tick for 3 columes, then everyone follow, so Park is difficult to find out who is really contributing to the class.
reviews.comment_workload:
You have midterm, final, video recording for paired presentation and that one need to prepare the PPT as well, and also for the final group project. Then finally have the report. I think these things are just too many for 1 course.

And originally the final is culmulative, but we vote to choose not to. Closed book exams are conducted and essay questions involved. Good Luck!
Hope you all find good group members.

reviews.author: outerspace
reviews.comment_content:
Class content is focused around strategy and different frameworks that can be used and applied to help a firm achieve superior, sustainable performance, and create value for all share/stakeholders involved. Interesting content that's taught in a way that is deeply linked to real life situations and cases, so makes it easy to digest and understand.

Content covers both the internal and external environment of the firm, and allows for students to get a deep understanding of how these influence and contribute to a firm's competitive advantage.
reviews.comment_teaching:
JT is a really knowledgable, kind, and funny professor. He breaks down very complex and technical terms and situations into simpler, easier to digest, and understandable terms. During class, he provides ample examples and opportunities for us to apply concepts and frameworks to real life situations, which is helpful for understanding how they work and why they would be useful.

I really got the feeling that he wanted us to learn and was personally very invested in teaching, and helping us to understand the content and do well. He also would periodically update us on current events that were relevant to the content we covered in class, which allowed us to further develop our knowledge and understanding of 1) the business world and 2) the content in a real life situation.

Overall, he's a really great professor!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grades will be determined as follows:
A. Individual work (50%)
  Class attendance and participation 20%
  Individual case report 20%
  Peer evaluation of all group-based work 10%
B. Group work (50%)
  Group case presentation 15%
  Final group mini-project presentation 20%
  Final group mini-project report 15%
reviews.comment_workload: OK workload for a 3 credit course - lots of readings for each week to be able to participate in class and group discussions. If you have a good group, the group work (2 project presentations, 1 final report) is not too hard, but coordination is difficult as groups are made up of around 7-9 people.

reviews.author: zslew
reviews.comment_content: A central theme of the course is the analysis of competitive advantage
reviews.comment_teaching: Overall teaching was good and lots of real life content learned.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual work (50%)
- Class attendance and participation 20%
- Individual case report 20%
- Peer evaluation of all group-based work 10%

Group work (50%)
- Group case presentation 15%
- Final group mini-project presentation 20%
- Final group mini-project report 15%
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy presentation and project workload. Almost 2 projects going on simultaneously. There are a lot of case studies that you have to read every week to be able to participate in class as well as for the group presentations.

reviews.author: MYGPASUCKS
reviews.title: biased prof... only like non-local and girls
reviews.comment_content:
blow water content
something like liberal studies (PESTEL forces)
extremely basic business analysis framework
with several case studies to complement (cases are a long time ago)
reviews.comment_teaching:
He has a MBB background. You gotta understand his accent.
He prepares a lot of examples to explain each concept/framework.

He will ask many questions during classes (a chance for you to get parti)
BUT HE will only pick the non-local and girls to ans (HOLLY)
If you are a local male, just pray.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 5
Participation : 10
Mid-term exam : 20
Final exam : 25
Group final project : 40

Midterm and Final above 0.5 sd
Project mean
Turned out B- (WTF for a mgmt course)
[My frd who is a korean girl, midterm below 1 sd, final & project mean --> A-
Prof's comment: appreciate her class participation lol (Reli?!)
reviews.comment_workload:
low...
in-class quiz every week
several case studies to prep (20 pages at most)

reviews.author: Angry bird
reviews.comment_content: We analyze different companies' strategy in class. I would say the content is fun but it doesn't help you prepare the exam at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the lessons are discussion of case. He will upload case on Canva and you have to finish a quiz and discuss in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
He is a funny prof who ask us not to care so much about the grade. He said he didn't get a high gpa in his UG. I don't get why his grading can be this bad. My major gpa is dragged down by this course.

40%final
The final is completely bullshit. We were given a super long case about a company M&A. You only got an hour or so to answer 4 questions.
prof said he intentionally set it to be this long to prevent cheating. i think everyone fxxk up. Most of my frds failed the exam.

40%project
You cant choose your own groupmates.
You an only cross your fingers. There are freeriders in my group and apparently we also fxxked up our project. We just mean.

20%parti
not released
reviews.comment_workload:
There is an online survey about the case assigned almost every week. As long as you answer something, mark will be given.

There is one project to analyze a company's competitive advantage and disadvantage and its strategy.

reviews.author: Samchy
reviews.comment_content:
1. explain the nature of strategic competitiveness and competitive advantages, and assess the competitiveness of companies
2. apply knowledge to analyze the competitive environment facing a firm, assess the attractiveness of its industry and isolate potential sources of competitive advantage and disadvantage.
3. develop solutions designed to build and sustain competitive advantage.
4. develop effective implement plans while considering the human element of organizations.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is willing to answer questions and he is nice to all students.

He put a lot of effort on the case study and ask many in-deep questions. And the case study can lead you to think more and it is useful for us to apply in the future.

And he is willing to provide many useful feedback for the presentation and proposal.

But one thing is that he sometimes just read the words on the powerpoint
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance:5%
Participation:10%
Mid-term exam: 20%
Final exam: 25%
Group final project :40Total percentage weights: 100%

midterm: 85/100
Final Exam: 93/110
Project and Presentation: Full Marks

Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload very few

Case Study for every week but don't count scores

Most of the workload is coming from the project and presentation

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.comment_content:
The Concept of Strategy
External Analysis: Industry Environment and Competition
Internal Analysis: Resources and Capabilities
Business Strategy (I): Analysis of Competitive Advantage
Business Strategy (II): Technology and Sustainability
Corporate Strategy: Diversification and Vertical Integration
Global Strategy and Strategic Alliances

Basic strategic consulting frameworks, nothing out of the world here.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is a very experienced and knowledgeable person. He gives a lot of real-world examples while teaching and talks about a company in-depth in most classes.

The classes are 3 hours long and he gives two 10-min breaks. But since he's a bit boring so I got distracted very quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Individual work (55%)
➢ Class attendance and participation 15%
➢ Final exam 35%
➢ Peer evaluation of all group-based work 5%

Group work (45%)
➢ Group case presentation 20%
➢ Final group mini-project presentation 25%

Final grade: A

The prof didn't release scores for ANYTHING. Not even the group projects or final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty less

reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty straight forward but also useful. They are basic strategies for business management studies. I study M&M so these are like essential concepts that I need to learn anyways.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, his teaching was kind of boring. He just reads from PowerPoint slides but interacts through asking us questions and new points to add on. However, he is very nice and friendly so it makes the atmosphere not bad for the class. The TA counts how many times you answer a question in class so it is important that you do so.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading for me. It was a special case for us due to social unrest our final exam was canceled. Midterm mean was 84 I got 88. Group project we got mean only. I got full attendance. It was a surprise that I finally got A.
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively light workload. I just studied for the midterm few days before. There was plenty of time to prepare for the group project.

reviews.author: jupsham
reviews.title: Content is useful and grades are good
reviews.comment_content:
Content is quite useful about business strategy and planning.
A lot of business case discussions so you can understand what creates a competitive advantage of one company and how to improve business positioning, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite easy to follow and to understand. The professor likes to ask a lot of questions and requires a lot of participation.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite fair and not bad.
Mid term: Mean
Final project: 100%
PRS Full marks
Final Exam canceled
Grade = A
reviews.comment_workload: The project is quite comprehensive and takes time, have to read and analyze a business case almost every other class for in-class discussion. Besides that only mid-term and final exam was canceled for this semester.

reviews.author: azeem_m
reviews.title: Boring, but easy
reviews.comment_content: Easy content, very boring. I'm an exchange student and I've learned this all before at my home uni.
reviews.comment_teaching: Qiang is very boring, sometimes he doesn't even know the content. He gets to slides and pauses for like 5 minutes. Seems like he hasn't seen the slides until that moment in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance - 5%
participation - 5%
group project - 25%
midterm - 30%
final - 35%
reviews.comment_workload: not hard at all. slides are very descriptive. i barely did any work all semester. only studied for midterm and final like 4 days prior to the date of the midterm.

reviews.author: Sammy
reviews.title: Great great course
reviews.comment_content: The content for the course is very interesting and useful. It gives a grander understanding of the news that we read. It helps us understand the factors behind key decisions made by companies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Pavel encourages students to participate in case discussions. He gives good examples through the lesson and helps understand all concepts easily.
reviews.comment_grading: I would say that it is very easy to score well. As long as you do well in the project presentation and report. It might be a bit challenging to come up with the ideas for the project report though. Trying to provide multiple strategies is a safe way to go. But make sure to try to include some details in the suggestions to make them more authentic. Also include materials and concepts from class. The exams were pretty easy.
reviews.comment_workload: There is the regular reading assignment and case discussion. That process just enriches the class learnings though and helps memorise more information.

reviews.author: hnc
reviews.title: A boring course with reasonable grading
reviews.comment_content: the content is very boring. mainly about theories and cases. Not much fun during learning, but are basic theories that should be learnt.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is very nice and friendly. He is very helpful and kind. The teaching is boring due to the materials. But he tried to bring in more interactions by asking questions and involving discussions.
reviews.comment_grading: I was below mean for around 1 sd for the midterm and at mean for the final. But seldom answered questions in class. participation is also important. The project is fine. the final grade is B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one project, one midterm and a final. The midterm only has MC while the final has both MC and long questions (case study type). Just going through all materials will allow u to be at mean for exams. And the project is done at the end of the semester. hence, the workload is for sure not heavy when compared to a lot of other courses in UST.

reviews.author: makmakmakmak
reviews.title: PARTICIPATE in class!!!
reviews.comment_content:
A lot of frameworks being introduced in this course and they can be useful during your interview group discussion. Some words being used in the ppt are very difficult to me and made it hard to understand so I have to look up from the dictionary a lot.
A case study pack will be given to students and there will be case discussion in class throughout the semester. the cases are around 10-20 pages long. You will have to read the cases beforehand in order to answer the PRS questions and participate in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor gave a lot of examples in class as he has worked in McKinsey before and knows a lot of things. But then other times he was basically reading powerpoint slides and his accent sometimes makes it hard to listen to what he is talking about.
Also during case discussion, he would jot down the points on papers and uses a projector to show us. But with his messy handwriting, it was difficult to read.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 5
-  IPRS is used at the start of every lesson and it starts sharply when class begins. There will be 3 question related to last class/case study of the day. Usually within the first 5 mins of class so better not to be late. It was said that you will have to answer at least 1q to get full attendance mark.

Participation: 10
- You will have to answer a lot of questions in class and the best chance is during case discussion. And it actually counts a lot. Can affect your subgrade.  

Mid-term exam: 20
- MC with a few short questions.

Final exam: 25
- MC, 5-page case questions and a few long questions. MC was said to be non-cumulative but turns out to be including the Midterm stuff.

Group final project: 40
- including presentation and final report. For the topic, you will have to analyze the corporate strategies of the company that you have chosen and then suggest possible ways to tackle the issues. Groups are being assigned by the prof but he really values peer evaluation, so if you have a serious issue, feel free to show him the proof.

I didn't miss any PRS attendance but should have zero for participation. My midterm was below mean for 2.5 marks, final being 9 marks above mean. Our group project was really good and among the highest. At last, I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not that high in the beginning but as project deadline approaches, you will become very busy especially when you have a lot of free riders in your group. But overall there are only 3 things you need to hand in:
1) interim report - for topic approval and not for grading
2) powerpoint slide
3) A 15-page report
Therefore if you start working on it earlier, the workload should be fine.

reviews.author: kat123
reviews.comment_content: The content is a bit theoretical and can't really apply them to real life situation. However, they are very easy to understand and don't need much time to study.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a very helpful and friendly professor. However, due to the content constraint, sometimes the lessons maybe a bit boring but overall he is a good professor.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is very good. As long as you pay attention to class, answer professor's questions, study the powerpoints before finals, have a normal performance in group project, your grade is secured.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low. Don't have much pressure during lessons. Just need to do some case readings beforehand.

reviews.author: Cat
reviews.title: Thanks YG
reviews.comment_content:
Rubbish content, all blow water that I could hardly remember anything after I finished exam...let alone now!

But I should still say some words right? It included M&A, internal and external transactions costs and synergy......
reviews.comment_teaching:
Laissez-faire Korean who created a relaxing learning atmosphere
He counted participated points as well, and it suited my needs so much as I liked to answered questions :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Better than I expcted than I aimed B/B- only
I did not perfom that good as everything like mid term and group project were mean

Indeed our project was very poor as YG kept saying there were many mistakes, but in the end our scores were mean

In the end I got B.
reviews.comment_workload: Middle la

reviews.author: olle
reviews.title: easy course with generous professor
reviews.comment_content: PESTEL forces, VRIO framework, SWOT analysis, and case analysis for most of the courses. Really helps students to be able to analyze firms' strategies and current performances based on systematic framework. Helpful and practical course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I could easily tell that he is really passionate for this course and has lots of knowledge/examples to share with his students. He answers questions really patiently.
His teaching style is little boring though. He just reads his slides and talks about cases without much visual/in-class activities.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance: 5
Participation : 10
Mid-term exam : 20
Final exam : 25
Group final project : 40

Full Mark on attendance and participation
1.3 SD above in midterm (96 out of 100)
1.2 SD above in final (92 out of 100)
Group project 98 out of 100

Got an A+

Midterm and Final only require 3~5 days of reviewing class slides as his exams are straightforward and only from his slides.
I liked how he does't quiz you on cases we review in class. Cases are just for more analytical skills and understanding.
reviews.comment_workload:
I was so lucky to have such hardworking group mates. The professor randomly assigns you into groups but somehow I got group mates who were all strong in writing quality reports and making quality presentations.

Exams are really easy and the average is high so make sure you do not make any mistakes.
His exam questions are easy to understand.

reviews.author: Jaanesh
reviews.comment_content: This course gives you insight on how to externally and internally analyse companies and how they are internally structured. For external, It looks at PESTEL, Porters 5 Forces, SCP Analysis, Industry Dynamics and Competitiveness. For Internal, it looks at Core Competencies, RBV and the VRIO Framework. It moves on to mention the different Business Strategies within business units and Corporate Strategies across boundaries. Then finally it wraps up with Formal Structure, Informal Culture and Governance.
reviews.comment_teaching: I loved this professor. He may be a little difficult to understand at times due to his accent, but he is a very knowledgable guy and is very enthusiastic about his course. I think this is one of the reasons I liked this course a lot. He would skip in class, always have a big smile on his face and teach with a lot of passion. He is a very friendly and understanding guy who is always willing to help.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Attendance - In the form of PRS Quizzes - Correct answers do not matter only participating in the PRS quiz matters.
5% Individual Participation
5% Group Participation (Based on Case Studies)
20% Midterm (MCQ)
25% Final (MCQ + Short Answer + Long Answer)
40% Group Project (10 Page Report + 10-15 Minute Presentation).
Professor is quite generous with the grading. Not too sure about the grade distributions though.
reviews.comment_workload: Not very heavy workload. The group project definitely involves a lot of research. But you get 15% of your grade for pretty much attending class on time. This course is quite easy and almost everybody does well because of it. The margin for error is extremely low and you need to be on top of everything in order to get a top score in this course. This course is pretty much common sense with additional vocabulary thrown at you. It should not be too tough and I recommend it to all

reviews.author: lonelyguy
reviews.comment_content:
Content is actually quite vague. You will need to think like a strategist and evaluate the company by different frameworks and concepts. If the company's policies are not sustainable and profitable, what changes we need to do? There will be 7 cases discussion in total to apply what we have learned from the lectures. The case is quite interesting and useful, but not the lecture.

Chapters included:
1. Introduction & Vision, Mission, and Values
2. Strategic Management Process
3. External Analysis (PESTEL, 5 Forces, SCP etc)
4. Internal Analysis (VRIO, core competencies)
5. Competitive Advantage
6. Business Strategies (Differentiation, cost leadership etc)
7. Corporate Strategy (M&A, Alliances, etc)
8. Global Strategy
9. Organizational Design & Structure
10. Culture, Control & Corporate governance
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures: Quite boring and quiet
Case: Interesting and intense

Maybe the content itself is not really interesting and more strategic-related. So, the class environment was serious and quiet af when the professor was talking. Pavel always smiled and he sometimes would laugh without any reason. It was good cause you will know that this professor is nice and won't black face all the time.

He is very knowledgable in corporate strategy. He used tons of real examples to define the concepts. But, sometimes he would focus too much on the example and did not really explain the definition very clearly. My friends and I always had lots of question marks in our mind after every lesson. Need some time to digest the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you are willing to participate, your grade won't be bad. If not, please swap to other professors since Pavel focuses much on participation.

Statistics:
10% Attendance and Quizzes: 10/10
15% Participation: unknown
20% Mid-Term Exam: 80/100 (Mean: 81.3, SD: 11.3)
25% Final: Cancelled
30% Project: 90/100 (Mean: 91.3, SD: 9.03)

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload belongs to the cases. There were 7 cases in total. Pavel would give you some guided questions to prepare for the case discussion. I spent quite a lot of time in preparing the cases and they are the chances for you to gain participation mark. Everyone was SUPER ACTIVE in the discussion, especially the non-locals.

Project: The 15 minutes project presentation was cancelled. So we only needed to hand in a 10-page report and the PowerPoint slides. Not really too difficult if you choose a company with much information available on the Internet.

reviews.author: lovestudying
reviews.comment_content: Mainly case study with some theories. Most of the stuff are learnt in Yr 1 and Yr 2. Content is rubbish. It cannot be applied in the real business world.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very boring and his tone makes people wants to sleep
Besides, since the prof emphasis on participation, many students  responded in order to get participation marks. Some of the responses were repetitive but the prof still kept allowing 10 students to answer the same question, and this slows down the class progress.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Class Attendance
5% Class Participation
25% Group Project
25% Midterm (MC)
40% Final
reviews.comment_workload:
Class Participation
Group Project
Midterm
Final
IPRS attendance

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.comment_content: Err 我無聽過書，入面d野全部common sense。對一個year 4 既人可以話0 Value added
reviews.comment_teaching:
好輕鬆既韓國人，上堂吹水式教學
除左non-local 之外都無乜人理佢。

D ppt 既字細到睇唔到。

不過佢離開ust啦，唔使講太多。
reviews.comment_grading:
40% final
呢份final 勁囉，全份卷都係吹水既，完全唔知同lecture有咩關連。

40% project
叫你分析一間公司既策略同提出建議。

仲有d 咩attendance parti

全mean，走左幾堂，有一份survey無交

reviews.comment_workload:
要做case survey，姐係逼你睇case。

Project 睇你遇到咩人啦，呢個project 令我見識到有d人係無common sense，唔識溝通。

Final 是但啦，溫唔溫答既野都係差不多。

Professor 唔再教啦，多謝咁多位用30秒既時間睇左呢段廢話。
